intro: Leucas acrodonta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces small, round fruits that contain seeds, and it thrives in well-drained soils. The leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
